comment.text: So so so so good! Will def be back! I had the lobster roll and lobster bisque and husband had grouper sandwich and both were excellent!

Visited on Jan. 7th, 2023 for lunch.  Giving it 1 star for the great wait staff we had, and best Lobster Bisque as usual, but was hoping for a great Lobster Roll too, but that was not the case!  Worst Lobster Roll all 3 of us have ever had!  (It ruined the whole experience, so can't give more stars.). It was Just a bun with plain lobster inside, with melted butter (not great butter either!) on the side - totally boring!   What made it even worse was that the lobster meat was the edge chewy pieces!  We had to spit out 80% of bites!  We'll hit Cousins next time for a real Lobster Roll!!  Caution!  Skip their boring-chewy-meat "Lobster Rolls"!!!

It's a Joe's Crab Shack type of vibe without the fancy name. The service was great and so was the crab, which is exactly what I came here for. It's near downtown and you can tell probably has some lively nights. Tried once and will come back, which based my stops at other seafood locations options is saying a lot.

This place was awesome! So unexpected in the middle of high rise buildings! Service was incredible, agree with others the lobster bisque was off the hook - loaded with seafood. Also had the crab dip and calamari - outstanding! No prices on the beer menu, pleasant surprise they were only 3.75 - we live in Mexico, where else is beer so inexpensive in the USA?? HIGHLY Recommend!

Excellent place to grab some great seafood and good drinks. The lady sitting next to us got a lemon drop cocktail and they add lemon drop candy to the drink. How fun!!! The lobster bisque was very good with plenty of lobster in the bowl. The lobster roll was amazing and my husband really enjoyed his shrimp. The servings were good sized and the servers were very friendly. I wish we would have found this place on our first day in town instead of our last night!!! Highly recommended

We ended up at Steamhouse Lounge after my brother recommended it. 
 And I was also craving some fried oysters.  We came on a Wednesday night, so it was easy to get a table.  Service was very friendly and the right amount of attentiveness.  We each ordered a basket of fried oysters with french fries and the fried calamari appetizer.  

The breading on both dishes were perfect; the right balance of flakiness, crispiness, and flavor.  We also really enjoyed the pinkish sauce that came with the calamari, and ended up asking for more to eat with our oysters since we're not fans of tartar sauce.  Portions were also pretty sizable with reasonable prices.  Overall a good experience that I'd definitely recommend.

On our trip to ATL, I'm glad I remembered to stop and try this establishment out before we decided to head back home to AL. And glad we did!! Glad this place still operated with this whole pandemic happening and glad they kept it as classes and sassy as always!! Loved my
Steamed Bucket Sampler and the family enjoyed their choice of meal! The beer were cold, lemon were fresh, and the quick food arrival was in tact!! Love this place, can't wait to stop on in again!!

photos.caption: Kids Grilled cheese and Cheeseburger w/ tots

comment.text: Whenever I get the chance , I will stop at Steamhouse for the best Lobster bisque I've ever had . The Oysters are tasty and the Grouper is fresh and cooked to perfection. Laid back atmosphere and friendly , attentive staff . Valet is available or street parking is conveniently across the street .

Wasn't expecting much from a seafood restaurant that's not at the beach but this was some of the best seafood I've ever had hands down! Can't wait to go back and try more of the menu. It's the perfect dive bar vibe and our waitress was super friendly. Got the grouper fingers and jalapeño white cheddar grits. Amazing

The lobster bisque is a must have! It was a little overwhelming to have our cups of soup come out as the same time as our entrees but the food was excellent. The oyster sampler was a fun way to try the different oysters at an affordable price. Tables outside are first come first serve.

photos.caption: Lobster Bisque Soup soooooo good! Must have!
Shrimp And Grits which has andouille as well!

comment.text: Super good seafood! I stopped in for dinner for the first time while visiting Atlanta. It's a seat yourself joint but all staff are wearing masks and following social distancing. I ordered a sweet water 420 beer since it is local to Atlanta and the lobster roll and lobster bisque combo ($21). It was absolutely delicious. The lobster roll was warm and came with a good amount of warm lobster and the bisque had good chunks as well. My mother ordered the crab cake sandwich and hush puppies which were also delicious. Server was attentive. Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Lobster Roll Lobster Bisque Soup Crab Cake Melt Hush Puppies

comment.text: Food was amazing, cold drinks, and waitress was as friendly as could be! Definitely will be back!

One of the best seafoods spots in downtown Atlanta. 10/10 good atmosphere and not overpriced. The low country boil is excellent. 
Will be back for sure.

Wanted to like this place. 

Adding this in after the below was posted ...been sick with the results no and stomach pain the next morning after eating here!!!!!!! 


The following was posted with an a few minutes of leaving the restaurant

They only had 1 kind of oyster and for a fish house our waiter had no choice dea where the oysters came from or the kind they were. Strike one 

We sat on the patio. It was nice but the waiter would vanish for 20 minutes at a time so we could not order more drinks 
Strike 2 

Wine came in a plastic cup. Never asked if I liked it and he put it in front of my guest who asked for water and she thought it was till she drank it. What if she was sober?  Huge strike number 3 

Well it might have a lot of great reviews in four stars I question have a God all that because our experience was a real poor quality. Goes to show you don't believe everything you read.

Love this place. I visit regularly for the oysters and the lobster bisque. I've had the fried platter, the tacos and a few other things from the menu but it's the oysters and bisque that keep me coming back. The service is never really that great unless we sit at a table but we usually hang out at the bar and down a few brews while enjoying the food. If you're looking for good oysters and great bisque, Steamhouse is it.

I give Steamhouse Lounge a solid four stars. I like this place. The food, service, and atmosphere are all great.

This is a seafood restaurant and it's an Atlanta institution. It was originally located in Buckhead until moving to Midtown in July 2008. You've probably passed by the two-story, light-blue-colored building on West Peachtree St. It looks like a large house. These guys have hosted the Atlanta Oysterfest for 32 years running.

Valet parking is available for $2 plus tip. Metered street parking is also available right next to the restaurant on 11th St. Pay with your phone and monitor/add time to your meter using the Parkmobile app (zone 51106). I paid $3.30 for 1.5 hours of parking. Parking is free on Sunday.

The restaurant has a laid-back beach/dock house vibe. It's not pretentious or one of those new restaurants with a "modern" spin on things. It's old school and established. This is a casual, seat-yourself type place. There are two levels, each having its own bar, with multiple seating options and areas. There are TVs to watch sports and the second level has a spacious, L-shaped deck. The bartenders and servers are friendly and the ambiance is comfortable.

One thing I like about this place is that they're open late - until 11pm Sunday-Thursday and 12am Friday-Saturday.

Steamhouse Lounge has a raw bar with oysters, clams, mussels, and shrimp ($12-30 each); fried seafood baskets ($10-15 each including fries), salads ($6-7 each), starters and bar food ($9-13 each) like crab dip, shrimp and scallop quesadillas, and oysters various ways (e.g. Oysters Rockefeller); their famous award-winning lobster bisque (from $5 a cup to $17 per quart); seafood sandwiches, burgers, and tacos ($9-20 each) such as lobster rolls, Baja fish tacos, and Louisiana-style po' boys; entrees like seafood boils, shrimp and grits, and snow crab; and desserts ($5-6 each) like pie and cheesecake. Drink-wise, the bar offers a variety of local, domestic, and import beer plus wine and cocktails.

There are also seasonal beers (local stuff like Terrapin, Scofflaw, and Red Hare) and daily specials. When we visited, the daily specials were:

* Monday - 1 lb of snow crab with size for $15 (regular price for 1.5 lb snow crab with two sides is $34), $5 Goombay Smashes (regularly $8)
* Tuesday - $1.50 beers
* Wednesday - 1 dozen raw or 1/2 dozen chargrilled oysters for $9 (regular price for 1 dozen raw oysters is $18), $4.50 house wine
* Thursday - $5 featured drink

We ordered a dozen raw oysters ($18) and they were fresh and delicious. While not among the best oysters I've had, they were fair for the price. They were Gulf oysters, mild in flavor and brine. I'd say they were average in size. They were shucked nicely and served atop a bed of ice with lemon wedges and two ramekins, each with cocktail sauce and horseradish.

I had the New Orleans po' boy ($11) made with fried catfish, remoulade, lettuce, and tomato with a side of hush puppies. Other po' boy options include fried oysters and shrimp. The po' boy was delectable, but messy to eat. The fried catfish fillet was ginormous and oversized for the sandwich bun (a good problem to have). It had a scrumptious batter and was well-seasoned with good flavor. Very meaty and yummy.

The hush puppies were excellent. I grew up eating hush puppies at The Hungry Fisherman in the 80s and Steamhouse Lounge's hush puppies are some of the best I've had anywhere. I highly recommend them. I got four with my po' boy order. They were served warm, crispy on the outside and soft on the inside, and tasted amazing.

My fiancee had the lobster bisque and salad (cup of bisque, $10) and really enjoyed it. She said it was good. I'm allergic to lobster so I didn't try it. Big portion on the salad that came with the bisque. It contained iceberg lettuce, cucumber, diced tomato, and shredded cheese. My fiancee got balsamic as the dressing. The salad was tasty with fresh and crisp veggies.

Our primary server was Philip though more staff than just he served us. Everyone we interacted with was nice and did a fine job.

I look forward to returning, especially on a Wednesday for that one dozen raw oysters for $9 deal.

photos.caption: Outside. Storefront. Entrance. Valet parking costs $2 + tip. You can also park on the street (metered).
Outside. Storefront. Entrance. Valet parking costs $2 + tip. You can also park on the street (metered).
Food menu (1 of 2). Raw bar, fried baskets, salads, starters & bar grub, soups, Eleanor's Eats.
Food menu (2 of 2). Sandwiches, burgers & tacos, entrees, desserts, sides.
Drink menu (1 of 2). Local beers, domestic, import.
Drink menu (2 of 2). Wine (whites, reds, sparkling). Specialty drinks.

comment.text:
Had the crab stuffed shrimp and crab stuffed grouper with jalapeño grits.

Our waiter suggested both and they didn't disappoint!

Yurm yurm yurm!!! Decided to grab some seafood because well... I was hungry!!! All of the food was really good! The shrimp and grits though, were bomb.com!!!! Im usually not a fan of super creamy grits, however, they did a really good job with theirs. The sauce had just enough kick and flavor it was really really good! The stuffed crab shrimp was creamy and came a part/separated from the crab when you picked it up. The muscles were delicious as well, however, they were a tad bit small. But overall, I really cant complain! I love this restaurant!

This place never disappoints me. The food is always fresh and very good. I'm so happy as there was no wait and I received such great service. This is always worth the effort to visit! The best lobster bisque ever!

My mom suggested dinner here last night. There is $2 valet which was super convenient and cheap. Our server was a sweetheart, very attentive and great energy.  It's casual, seat yourself Cheers Iike atmosphere. 

We started our meal with the famous lobster bisque and cheese toast.  The bisque was delicious  and did not disappoint.  I'm used to bisque being thicker this was not but I did not mind it was yummy and full of lobster! Mom was a little upset that hers wasn't as meaty. That did not stop her from taking a cup to go...wish I had...lol The cheese toast was a perfect combination. Mom ordered a spinach salad and side of shrimp. I ordered the catfish basket and an electric lemonade (drink special).  My drink was just ok but I'm a former bartender so there's that. The shrimp were crunchy and tasty.  The catfish was ok but let's just say I should have ordered the shrimp. We love a good tarter sauce but can't put this one on the list. 

So all in all, I enjoyed my visit, the relaxed setting and would come back for bisque, shrimp and salad for sure.

photos.caption: Mom and I..pic in booth near bar

comment.text: Steamhouse gets 5 stars from me!! I wish I would've taken more pictures because EVERYTHING was excellent. Myself and 3 other friends all ordered a different appetizer to share. I got the fried calamari, someone else got the fried oysters, there was also crab stuffed shrimp and shrimp and scallop nachos. Everything that I just listed was delicious, fresh and presented so nicely. We also sat and ate on their beautiful balcony. The salmon dinner I ordered was excellent, I could not put my fork down. I would love to come here again. Great service as well! very friendly!

photos.caption: Salmon Dinner w/ potatoes and broccoli

comment.text: It's always a good time here at Steamhouse. The lobster bisque is absolutely the best I've ever had. It's always my go to appetizer/soup. My husband loves the grouper basket and I always get the Crab and shrimp dinner. Great beer selections as always and the kids love it here too! Having valet service is def a plus due to the crazy Atlanta traffic and they are always nice. Service is always on point. We love it here.

It was an amazing experience. The location is in a prime area. The feel is very casual, almost neighborhood hangout-ish in a way. Upon walking in we were greeted immediately. We decided to sit inside as it was a bit too hot outside for me. LoL!

The service was very upbeat and inviting from the beginning. Our server took our drink orders immediately. She had an opinion on everything on the menu I asked her about. I ended up with the Grouper Finger meal per her feedback and I was very pleased with my decision. 

The Grouper was golden fried. Moist and flaky on the inside. The French Fries were perfectly seasoned and done to perfection. I ordered the cheese toast as well, it could use a lot more cheese but it was good overall. 

I will definitely be returning. 

Environment- 8/10
Service- 10/10
Food- 10/10
Value- 9/10

Strolled in on a Tuesday night after I got a bit turned around in midtown so much so that I decided to just park at the next place I passed. So happy that I did! It's a relaxed restaurant with *great* food but also an enjoyable local, yet calm bar scene. It was refreshing! Chris - the bartender who was working was exceptional. My drink was wonderful. Food, again, was immaculate. 10/10 would recommend. (Get the grilled garlic parm oysters and a bowl of their famous lobster bisque, you won't be disappointed!!!)

Love the happy hour specials! However I hate that they won't do it togo! 

Otherwise the oyster specials are great  definitely worth the post work quick stop!

If you love inexpensive, dive bar style seafood--Steamhouse is the perfect spot. 

They have free valet parking available, or a lot right across the street on W. Peachtree that is $5. Both options are incredibly convenient.

We have been here multiple times and their menu options are a hit or miss. To me, their "hit" items are all of the fried baskets, Lobster Bisque, hush puppies, or the oysters (raw or baked). So basically everything unhealthy lol. 

I recently got the Mahi Mahi blackened and thought the fish was incredibly dry. So I wouldn't necessarily recommend any of the fish options here. They have lots of options available for those that want a healthier option, but it's definitely not the tastiest item on the menu.

photos.caption: Mahi Mahi, Blackened, with Broccoli and Seasoned Steamed New Potatoes

comment.text: Oh my goodness I cannot recommend this place enough. Our server, Darwin was so hospitable and great to chat with. We got the calamari and the oysters that were on special. Both were fantastic. Darwin talked up the calamari, at some places the batter is just not it, but I'm so glad to say that it hit the SPOT. The food is amazing, but more than anything Darwin is just the BEST server. Highly recommend, will definitely be coming back.

Had an absolutely fabulous meal and drinks with the hubby and a friend. And the meal was so good I forgot to take notes for my review.

The two I wrote were:
- Outstanding oysters!
- Husband had the best drink at the table; the house special: Coco Le'Mango- mainly coconut rum and mango. Deliciously fruity and intoxicating.
- Nice server.

I honestly think that's all that needs to be said.

We shall return.

And I'll take more notes.
LOVE THIS PLACE!!! The l bisque is amazing! You also can't beat the pricing. Definitely recommend to everyone.

The family and I have visited Steamhouse a few times before and it's always a pleasant experience! This time around we had Carl as our waiter and our service was impeccable. We had our toddler with us and he made sure she was happy and entertained from the very moment he greeted us at the table. He went above and beyond by bringing her juice out to keep her occupied while we looked over the menu, having her food come out first so she could finally get her fee fies (also known as french fries) she'd been asking about all day, and offering to put one of the TV's on Disney channel for her to enjoy while she ate. As a parent I appreciate those acts immensely. Now on to the food! If you're a seafood lover Steamhouse is your spot. They serve everything from fish and shrimp dishes to crab cakes, oysters, and seafood boils. They also have an array of beer, wine, and specialty drinks. To start off the night we ordered a 1800 Texas margarita ($14) and a Coco Le mango cocktail ($8.50). The margarita was delicious as always so no complaints there but the Coco Le mango was too sweet and tasted like plain old juice. It was still tasty and I love a good tropical juice but I need my cocktails with some kick to it...I need to taste the liquor. For our appetizer we ordered the spicy shrimp and scallop nachos ($13). They were amazing and a good size to be just an appetizer! For our entrees we decided on 2 fried catfish baskets ($13 each) one with pepper jack grits added on ($4). The catfish was large and well seasoned but a bit overly breaded. The fries were crispy, crinkle cut, and lightly sprinkled with a nice spice blend. The grits were nice, thick, and creamy but needed more pepper jack cheese. While everything I've tried on the menu so far has been pretty good, I definitely have my absolute favorites which is what keeps me coming back.

photos.caption: Spicy shrimp and scallop nachos, so good!
Catfish basket with pepper jack grits
Coco Le mango and Texas margarita

comment.text:
Pro tip: no happy hour here. It pops up in the search as such, but there's none, which seems kinda weird for the location (there's a ton of other spots nearby that have one!) 

Simple, basic seafood. We ordered a bottle of Sauv Blanc, enjoyed the sunny patio and some peel and eat shrimp. 

Hadn't been here in years, and while nothing was particularly wrong, prob will keep checking out new spots for happy hour hours. 

The service was efficient and kind. But the plates are plastic, and that's just a quality thing for me personally. 

I'd love to see some dishes and better glassware here... or if it stays the same, a killer happy hour. I'm pretty sure that's why it was so quiet at 5pm.

Delicious! Great service and the food did not disappoint. The bar tender was very generous as well! I highly
Recommend for a variety of seafood options and sides

This was a loooonnnggg drive for some lobster bisque.  My boyfriend was craving some of this, and he said they had the best he's ever had.  Okay, when you hear words like that, it automatically makes you want to try it.  So off we went.  Parking wasn't too bad, actually found a metered spot, and it wasn't crazy, $4 for two hours.

The restaurant has both outdoor and inside seating, but it was chilly, and the outdoors appeared to not be open.  The place is kind of divey.  I mean, it's certainly not a place where you need to dress up.  In fact, I would feel out of place if I had.  We sat at a high top, and the chairs were uncomfortable.  I also felt like the floor was kind of off, because I felt like I was going to slide down outta my chair at any moment.   Service was also subpar.  She just didn't seem to care about the lack of space on the table, considering there were three of us and things like mussels with an extra bowl take up a lot of room.  She was never in a hurry to clear anything either.

Now for the bisque...I really was disappointed, and I'm not sure if it's like when you go to the movies and you hear amazing things prior to seeing the show that it's automatically always a letdown but I felt the bisque was overrated.  Now, I know I am in the minority of patrons here on this opinion. It did have a lot of lobster meat in it, but flavor-wise, I felt it was just okay.  Three bites, and I was good, and I think the two latter were to reconfirm that it wasn't all that great.  Sorry.  I will say my boyfriend really enjoyed it.

The rest of the food was equally so-so, and the rum punch was lacking in well...PUNCH.  Not sure if there was rum or not in there.  We had the mussels, which I did not care for the broth.  We also had some grits, which were pretty bland.  The lobster roll was tasteless to me, but the price was decent.  I also tried an oyster with cheese that was just okay, didn't really leave me wanting more.  

Subpar meal, disappointing at best.

My husband & I went just as a little outing. I love the environment. We sat outside in the upstairs area. He has been before & it was my first time going ... I LOVED IT. The view of the city & the sunset while eating was PERFECT!!! Our server was so helpful & his energy was great! Definitely will be back!

Came here for the first time on 8/30/2021 to catch up with some friends and we were highly satisfied with our experience and the food! My friend recommended Steamhouse because he had been before and mentioned that on Mondays they did a special on crab legs. (A pound and a side for $20!). Sold on that from the jump!

Our server was Dean, and he was simply the kindest, patient, and most accommodating. Also had a great sense of humor! We sat outside on the upper deck area which offered great fresh air and some city ambiance. We started with the Spicy Shrimp & Scallop Nachos which were simply soooo delicious and full of flavor! Very shareable, but so good you might over eat your shared portion!

We then each ordered the pound of crab legs and had our own individual sides of corn, cheese toast, and pepper jack grits. We were all satisfied with our sides, me in particular definitely enjoyed the cheese toast. Butter and lemon is provided with the old bay seasoned crab legs that were very fresh and steamed properly. We topped off the nice with the Grilled Garlic Parmesan Oysters which were soooooo savory! Grilled just right, and was a nice change from traditional 'slimy'/cold oysters that I've had before.

Completely satisfied with Steamhouse and will be back again soon!

If you want very tasty and fresh seafood, Steamhouse lounge is the place to go. We are very happy with the amount of seafood that was in the steamed sampler, only downside was the mussels were very small. If you prefer to eat seafood for its natural taste rather than for a strong seasoned flavor, I highly recommend the steam. The lobster roll was absolutely delicious and had a very generous amount of lobster per roll. The best was the lobster bisque which was flavorful of lobster with a nice creamy taste. Food was ready for for pick after fifteen minutes and was nicely packed and ready to go when I arrived. They put all the sauces and lemons in an open container at the top of bag, I would've appreciated if the lemons were in a closed container. Other than that I am very happy with this place and will definitely go again!!

photos.caption: Steamed Seafood Sampler Lobster Roll And Cup Of Bisque
Lobster Roll And Cup Of Bisque

comment.text: We come here often (weekly) and never had a bad experience! Food is always amazing and staff is great! Definitely gets busy around 5pm , love the outdoor patio area outside main entrance!!
10/10 came here on vacation and service and food was beyond amazing. The lobster bisque was banging...I mean everything was top notch. If you are in the area you have to stop by.
The best seafood in Atlanta.. the closest thing I've had (so far) to New Orleans Style cooking without being in New Orleans! Everything was fresh and tasty! The Lobster Bisque Soup is to die for!!!

Hmm! My expectations were a little high based other Yelp reviews. Firstly service was Awesome. I got Oyster/Boiled Shrimp Ap, Shrimp was good, but Oysters were small & seemed to have been shucked a while back & left in the fridge.

Mmmm!!! $9 oysters, you can't beat that! Servers were great, very attentive! They refilled my drink when I didn't even notice it was empty! I don't have anything to really complain about except the food... it made me too full! Haha! 

We ordered the spicy shrimp and scallop nachos, omg, it was really really good, perfect amount of cheese and toppings although next time I will ask for no scallions on top. 

We also got the cold crab dip. That was surprisingly good too! When all you're eating is cold oysters, and then you have the hot flat bread with the dip, it's so yummy! 

Crab cake is probably the best I've ever had! You can get a piece of crab in every bite. My boyfriend ordered a cup of chili that he shared with the guys. 

Stay away from the nachos though!! It wasn't the best. We ordered the shrimp nachos and the mahi mahi. 3tacos per order. Actually the shrimp taco is not bad but the guys said the mahi mahi had an awful stench to it. 

For desert, the girls got key lime pie, which I would have like if it was more on the tangy side, and the guys got the chocolate peanut butter mousse that they absolutely enjoyed, my boyfriend said it tasted like a Reese's peanut butter cup. 

Between the the four of us (there were six but two female friends don't like oysters), we ordered 8 dozen oysters, definitely could have ordered more but we just had so much food! Waited all year long until the waters was cool enough for these babies. Definitely hit the spot! Give it a try if you're craving oysters on a Wednesday night!

photos.caption: Cold crab dip. Such a bad picture but we were hungry we just all went for it!
Yummyyyy I would def order this again without scallion

comment.text: This place is pretty good. They have a pretty good consistent good service and good food. I come here often. Every Wednesday a dozen raw oysters are $12.

photos.caption: Where is the crab?? It's mostly filler
I love their salad! Now let's go this lobster bisque and see what it do!
They actually have lobster in the lobster bisque.. how bout that!

comment.text: This is a frequent spot for me and I have attended the Oysterfest 3 years in a row. Today, I stopped by to grab a drink....maybe two and some oysters. I sat outside and was greeted by two 2 waiters for my order. I ordered calamari, mango beer and an order of oysters with garlic and parmesan cheese. Now, I gave it a 3 because there was hair baked in my oysters and on the cloth napkin. Well I let the waiter know and he quickly resolved the situation. It was a nice day to sit outside and have a craft beer or two. They brought another order of oysters with no hair and the manager came out and apologized. It's a fav of mine and I will return. The waiter was nice too and even though the food wasn't on point this I still left him 40%. I'll be back!!

photos.caption: Calamari and oysters with Mango wheat beer.

comment.text:
So amongst the few hundred pics in my phone of food from establishments that I've yet to review, I ran across an oldie, but goodie! Shame on me for not doing this review soon, as I've been patronizing this joint for years; at least five plus (5+) years. 

On to the food...I'm a fan. The lobster bisque is unique, but in a good way. Definitely lobster in every bite and it seems to be a favorite as I've seen several tables order it. The oysters also seem to be a hit here. On this particular visit I accompanied the bisque with a lobster roll. Not much to say, but get it. Served on a warm poppyseed bun with a good amount of meat with the butter and mayo (optional) on the side. 

If you're in the Midtown area stop by and give them a try. They have seating downstairs, upstairs, and outdoors. Would've given them four (4) stars, but they do not have draft beer. Hey, it's important people!! Btw, I sat at the bar...

The food was very good.  Service was good.  Vibe was good.  However, they have a $30 entree that doesn't come with any sides.  I think that is a little ridiculous.  We had the seafood sampler and the salmon dinner, oysters rockefeller.  All very good.

I haven't been in a while but I'm glad I came back. Freshest seafood I've had in the city in a long while. Mussels were my fav! Whenever I'm in midtown with a hankering for oysters I'll be at Steamhouse. This was my first time dining on the patio and it was clean, pleasant, and relaxing. Our server Danielle was the sweetest. Glad to now consider this one an old faithful.

Love the fried shrimp basket and the customer service is always good. The mixed drinks are good too. I typically get the whiskey sour with the lemon heads  the bartender is heavy handed I love it. The lobster bisque is awesome too, truly the best I have had and I've traveled
We did not quite like the seat yourself model when it was so busy as people weee waiting at least 30 minutes standing waiting for a table

On a family vacation, we tried this place based on the recommendation of our Uber driver. The service and the food did not disappoint. I shared oysters with the family, but I had the shrimp tacos entree. Simply Scrumptious! Full bellies all the way around. It was the best restaurant and service we had the whole time we were in GA.

The parking here is a little horrible, but you can't have high expectations when it comes to parking with the majority of restaurants in Atlanta.

The service here is the reason why I took away two stars. The sever had several tables she was trying to handle at the same time. My drink kept coming out wrong, I'm not sure why there were so many issues when all I asked for was Soda water with lime and lemon lol. We also had to get another waiter to give us refills.

I got the lobster rolls w. fries and it was about $18. Hubster got a catfish Po Boy and it was about $12. The catfish was huge. The lobster was a little plain so ask for the jalapeño tartar sauce to go with it and a lemon. All together we spent $35. 

I'm glad that we finally got a chance to try it, but I definitely wouldn't return.
